context_of_use: This use case allows receptionists to access and view patients' electronic medical records for administrative purposes.
stakeholders_and_interests: Receptionist: Needs access to patient information for contact and administrative tasks.
description: Allow receptionists to view patients’ electronic medical records needed for contact and administrative tasks.
triggering_event: Receptionist initiates a request to view a patient's electronic medical record.
preconditions: Receptionist is logged into the hospital management system.
Receptionist has the necessary permissions to view medical records.
postconditions: Receptionist successfully views the patient's electronic medical record.
assumptions: The system has a functioning electronic medical record database.
The receptionist has been granted appropriate access rights.
requirements_met: The system shall allow receptionists to view patients' electronic medical records.
The system shall manage access control to ensure only authorized personnel can view records.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on data privacy measures for patient records.
main_flow: 1. Receptionist requests to view a patient's electronic medical record → System retrieves the patient's electronic medical record.
2. System displays the patient's electronic medical record → Receptionist reviews the information.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If the receptionist does not have access rights, the system displays an error message and denies access.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If the system fails to retrieve the electronic medical record, the system displays an error message indicating the failure.
